group_1.textLeft: Thank you for helping me.
By the way... who might you be?

group_1.textRight: Ah! Sorry I didn't introduce myself.
My name Natsuki Utsuho.
I'm a Magical Girl in the Kamihama Magia Union!

group_1.textLeft: The Union...

group_1.textRight: Yep!@You're Shizuka Tokime, right?

group_1.textLeft: That's right, but... how do you know that?

group_1.textRight: Iroha said...

group_1.narration: "Since we've decided to join forces@with everyone in the Tokime Clan,@please give them a hand if they're in trouble."

group_1.textRight: ...And so, the entire Union was contacted.
Since you might get in trouble if you're not used to@the city and all.

group_1.textLeft: Iroha...

group_1.textRight: At that time, we were shown photos of everyone@in your group too.
I thought it was excessive then, but it looked like@you ran into trouble after all.

group_1.textLeft: No, thank you for saving me.

group_1.textRight: No no! If we're in trouble, we should help@each other out!
Is there anywhere you'd like me to guide you to?

group_1.textLeft: That's kind of you to do, but...

group_1.textRight: But?

group_1.textLeft: Well...

group_1.textRight: I see... So you're making a map for your friends@coming to Kamihama.

group_1.textLeft: But there are so many shops.
I just don't know how to put it all together...

group_1.textRight: Would you like me to give you some@recommendations?

group_1.textLeft: Eh...

group_1.textRight: I've been going to Suitoku Shopping Center@since I was little.
I think I can show you the essentials@for living here!

group_1.textLeft: ...Are you sure?@Even though it might take a while?

group_1.textRight: Yeah! I don't have any club activities today.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you!
Um, may I call you Miss Utsuho?

group_1.textRight: If you don't mind, you can just call me Natsuki.

group_1.textLeft: Then, Natsuki, I'm fine with being called Shizuka too.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, nice to meet you, Shizuka!
I recommend this place for fish!

group_1.textLeft: Um... P-pwa...?

group_1.textRight: It's Poisson March√©.

group_1.textLeft: Ugh, that's hard to remember unless@you're used to it...

group_1.textRight: Then, if you don't know the place, just ask people@in the shopping district.
Just say that you want to go to Mr. Gyoden's place.

group_1.textLeft: Mr. Gyoden...?@Is that the shop owner's name?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, until a while ago, the shop was called@"Gyoden's Fish Shop".
I think the people in the shopping district are more@familiar with that name!

group_1.textLeft: I see...@I'll write that down.

group_1.textRight: Sundries are available at this shop.
Ah, and vegetables should be next door.

group_1.textLeft: The locals really know the area like you said.
And if I'm not mistaken, Sankyoin's school@is nearby, right?

group_1.textRight: It's actually right around the corner,@wanna have a look?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, some children must go to this school.
This school is so big...

group_1.textRight: We do have a lot of students going here.

group_1.textLeft: I'll add this place to the mapu too.
By the way, you don't engage in bartering, right?

group_1.textRight: Bartering...isn't something I've done.
Does your hometown still do that?

group_1.textLeft: Until recently, people in the village would rarely@go out.
The village's managers would take care of shopping@outside.
So what we had is what they brought back.
Everything would be shared and exchanged as@needed in the village.

group_1.textRight: Huh, I see why shopping is hard for you to get@used to...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, but I do like this shopping district.
Everyone's kindness makes me feel warm inside.
I'm sure the girls in the branch families would@enjoy spending time here too.

group_1.textRight: I'm glad to hear you say that!
Ah, we've arrived at the butcher's!

group_1.textLeft: Let's see... groceries are good, sundries are good...
The mapu is filling up wonderfully.

group_1.textRight: So next up is clothes?

group_1.textLeft: Right... Where would I go for that?

group_1.textRight: Hmm... that's not as easy to find in the shopping@district.

group_1.textLeft: There isn't a store that sells clothing here?

group_1.textRight: No, there is, but it's not for younger kids.
If you want to buy clothes, everyone goes to the@shopping mall.

group_1.textLeft: Shawpping mawl...
...Ahh, a shop full of other shops...
Could you show me around?

group_1.textRight: Will do! Please leave it to me!
